skill.name: improve-skill
skill.description: Analyze coding agent session transcripts to improve existing skills or create new ones. Use when asked to improve a skill based on a session, or extract a new skill from session history.
skill.summary: Analyze coding agent session transcripts to improve existing skills or create new ones. Use when ask...
skill.author: Dwsy

security_audit.summary: This skill is a legitimate utility that reads agent session files to extract and format transcripts. It only accesses known agent directories for its documented purpose and performs no network calls or external command execution.

content.value_statement: Users struggle to capture and reuse successful patterns from coding sessions. This skill extracts session transcripts from Claude Code, Pi, and Codex to help you create or improve reusable skills.
actual_capabilities: Extract session transcripts from Claude Code, Pi, and Codex
Parse and format JSONL session files into readable text
Auto-detect the current agent based on working directory
Generate prompts for improving existing skills
Generate prompts for creating new skills from sessions
Locate skill files across different agent directories
limitations: Only reads session files; does not modify or create skills directly
Requires the agent session files to exist on the filesystem
Cannot analyze sessions from agents other than Claude Code, Pi, or Codex
Session data must be in JSONL format to be parsed

use_cases.title: Refine Your Workflows
use_cases.description: Extract sessions where you struggled and create improvement prompts to make future sessions smoother.

use_cases.title: Capture Team Knowledge
use_cases.description: Document successful patterns from expert sessions and turn them into reusable team skills.

use_cases.title: Learn Best Practices
use_cases.description: Create onboarding skills from expert sessions that demonstrate proper tool usage and workflows.

prompt_templates.title: Extract Current Session
prompt_templates.prompt: Run ./scripts/extract-session.js to extract the current session transcript.

prompt_templates.title: Specify Agent Type
prompt_templates.prompt: Run ./scripts/extract-session.js --agent claude to extract from Claude Code specifically.

prompt_templates.title: Improve Existing Skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the improve-skill to analyze this session and generate a prompt for improving the existing skill at ~/.claude/skills/my-skill/SKILL.md.

prompt_templates.title: Create New Skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the improve-skill to analyze this session and generate a prompt for creating a new skill called pattern-name based on what was accomplished.

output_examples.input: Extract the current session and help me improve my code-review skill
output: Found Claude Code session with 47 messages
Generated improvement prompt targeting code-review skill

best_practices: Extract sessions soon after completing work while context is fresh
Focus on specific struggles or discoveries rather than general improvements
Keep skill improvements concise with practical examples
anti_patterns: Analyzing sessions without identifying clear improvement points
Creating skills from single sessions without validating the pattern
Making skills too broad instead of focused on specific use cases

faq.question: What agents does this skill support?
faq.answer: Claude Code, Pi, and Codex. The script auto-detects based on your working directory.

faq.question: Can I use this without the extract script?
faq.answer: Yes, but manual transcript extraction is required. The skill works with any session text.

faq.question: Is my session data sent anywhere?
faq.answer: No. The script runs locally and only reads files on your machine. No network calls are made.

faq.question: Why does the improvement happen in a new session?
faq.answer: Starting fresh reduces token usage and prevents context contamination from the current task.

faq.question: How is this different from regular prompting?
faq.answer: This skill provides structured workflows and templates specifically designed for skill development.
